entries.title: CDC says it’s ‘very unlikely’ Pfizer booster carries stroke risk for seniors after launching review
entries.description: The CDC said one of its monitoring systems detected a preliminary safety signal for stroke in people ages 65 and older who received the Pfizer omicron booster.

entries.title: U.S. will hit its debt limit Thursday, start taking steps to avoid default, Yellen warns Congress
entries.description: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen wrote House Speaker Kevin McCarthy, "It is unlikely that cash and extraordinary measures will be exhausted before early June."

entries.title: Brian Moynihan says Bank of America expects 'mild recession' and is preparing for worse
entries.description: The CEO's statement mirrors the earnings report for JPMorgan Chase, whose economic outlook calls for "a mild recession in the central case."

entries.title: 'Flash' star Ezra Miller avoids jail with plea deal for unlawful trespass in Vermont
entries.description: Ezra Miller, star of "The Flash," agreed to a plea deal to avoid jail related to an incident in which they allegedly stole alcohol from a neighbor's home.

entries.title: Four troubling global trade trends flashing consumer weakness for a market already fearing recession
entries.description: Global trade, manufacturing, and warehouse trends provide a picture of consumer health and the economy. It's not looking good right now.

entries.title: Trump Organization hit with $1.6 million fine for criminal tax fraud scheme
entries.description: Two subsidiaries of the Trump Organization, former President Donald Trump's business, were hit with fines of $1.6 million at sentencing.

entries.title: Citigroup's fourth-quarter profit declines by 21% as bank sets aside more money for credit losses
entries.description: Citigroup reported fourth-quarter earnings on Friday. Here's how they did.

entries.title: Just one G-7 leader will join the Davos elite this year as regular people battle cost-of-living crisis
entries.description: While the WEF summit has had low G-7 attendance in the past, one political advisor said leaders would be especially wary amid the cost-of-living crisis.

entries.title: Scaramucci says SkyBridge can buy back FTX stake this year, alleges SBF 'committed fraud’
entries.description: SkyBridge Capital can buy back the stake it sold to FTX, founder Anthony Scaramucci told CNBC.

entries.title: UK economy ekes out growth in November surprise — but recession still seen as inevitable
entries.description: A Reuters poll of economists had forecast a 0.2% contraction amid a bleak overall picture for the British economy.

entries.title: Biden advisor says oil price cap is working as Russia takes economic hit
entries.description: Amos Hochstein, special presidential coordinator to Joe Biden, told CNBC the G7's oil price cap had so far "achieved our interest."

entries.title: Sweden finds Europe's largest deposit of rare earth metals, which could become 'more important than oil and gas'
entries.description: Swedish mining company LKAB discovered one million metric tons of rare earth oxides, which are used in electric vehicles and wind turbines.

entries.title: Putin's military command reshuffle reveals a power struggle at the heart of the Ukraine war
entries.description: Tension has been mounting in recent months between Russia's military commanders and Wagner Group leader Yevgeny Prigozhin.

entries.title: Tesla cuts prices in the U.S. and Europe to stoke sales after lackluster year-end deliveries
entries.description: Electric vehicle maker Tesla is cutting prices in the United States and throughout Europe again, according to listings on the company's website.

entries.title: The Davos elite likes to make bold predictions. But they often get them wrong
entries.description: The World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, kicks off next week. Here's a recap of some of the calls made at the high-profile meeting in recent years.

entries.title: JPMorgan Chase is set to report fourth-quarter earnings — here's what the Street expects
entries.description: JPMorgan, the biggest U.S. bank by assets, will be closely watched for clues on how the industry is navigating an economy at a crossroads.

entries.title: A stablecoin collapse could spill into the U.S. bond market and economy, professor warns
entries.description: While there are no signs of major stablecoins collapsing, an economics professor at Cornell University says it's something regulators are worried about.

entries.title: China’s exports slump less than expected in December
entries.description: Strong exports bolstered China's economy in the last two years. But economists anticipate a slowdown in demand from the U.S. and Europe.

entries.title: South Koreans are the world's biggest spenders on luxury goods
entries.description: Morgan Stanley says South Koreans spend more on luxury goods per capita than even American or Chinese nationals.

entries.title: Why Singapore isn't imposing new travel rules on visitors from China
entries.description: Singapore's government cites statistics to show why new rules for Chinese travelers won't necessarily make Singapore safer from Covid-19 right now.

entries.title: Apple CEO Tim Cook requests and receives a 40% pay cut after shareholder vote
entries.description: Apple CEO Tim Cook will receive a pay cut in 2023, targeting $49 million in total compensation, the company said in an SEC filing.
